guides.title: What Do Giant Pandas Eat?

steps.title: Main diet
content: Bamboo — 99% of daily food
Pandas eat: Bamboo stalks, leaves, and shoots (their favorite)
steps.hint: Shoots are the richest in nutrients.

steps.title: Occasional extras
content: Sometimes pandas may eat: Small rodents, Birds, Eggs, Insects
steps.hint: This makes up only 1% of their diet.

steps.title: Daily intake
content: Pandas eat 12–38 kg (26–84 lbs) of bamboo per day
Feeding takes 10–14 hours a day
They prefer young shoots in spring and leaves in winter
steps.hint: Feeding is their main activity during the day.

steps.title: Why bamboo?
content: Fiber supports digestion
Protein (especially in shoots)
Calcium & phosphorus for strong bones
Water — up to 50% of hydration
steps.hint: They have a 'pseudo-thumb' to hold bamboo like a hand!

summary: Pandas must eat huge amounts because bamboo is low-calorie.
Without bamboo forests, pandas cannot survive.

faq.question: Are pandas herbivores?
faq.answer: Not biologically — they are classified as carnivores, but functionally they eat like herbivores.

faq.question: Do pandas eat meat regularly?
faq.answer: No. Their bodies are not adapted to digest much animal protein.

faq.question: Why do they eat so much?
faq.answer: Bamboo contains very few calories, so they need large quantities for energy.

guides.title: Creating the Perfect Habitat

steps.title: Temperature Control
content: Pandas thrive in cool, damp environments
Optimal temperature: 10°C to 20°C
Avoid direct hot sun for long periods
steps.hint: In the wild, they move higher up the mountains to stay cool.

steps.title: Altitude Matters
content: Wild pandas live at 1,200 to 3,100 meters
High altitude provides the necessary mist and humidity
Air quality must be pristine
steps.hint: Mist helps bamboo stay succulent and fresh.

steps.title: Humidity and Mist
content: Humidity levels should stay above 60%
Mist mimics the cloud forests of Sichuan
Constant moisture prevents bamboo from drying out
steps.hint: Cloud forests are the panda's natural air conditioner.

steps.title: Shelter and Cover
content: Dense vegetation for feeling secure
Hollow logs or caves for resting during rain
Natural barriers to reduce wind chill
steps.hint: Pandas spend a lot of time hiding while they digest.

summary: Cool temperatures are vital for panda comfort.
A healthy habitat mimics the Sichuan mountains.

faq.question: Can pandas live in tropical climates?
faq.answer: No, they overheat easily due to their thick fur.

guides.title: Understanding Panda Body Language

steps.title: The Scent Mark
content: Pandas rub scent glands against trees
Used to mark territory and find mates
Handstand marking: the higher the mark, the stronger the panda
steps.hint: They use scent because their eyesight isn't very sharp.

steps.title: Vocalizations
content: Bleating: A friendly greeting or 'I'm here'
Honking: Indicates stress or annoyance
Chirp: Usually a mother calling her cub
steps.hint: They have 11 different distinct sounds.

steps.title: Postures and Stances
content: Direct eye contact is often a threat
Lowering the head shows submission or shyness
Sitting upright while eating shows they feel safe
steps.hint: An upright panda is usually a relaxed panda.

summary: Scent is the primary way pandas 'talk'.
Body language helps avoid physical fights.

faq.question: Are pandas aggressive?
faq.answer: Generally no, they prefer to retreat, but can be dangerous if cornered.

guides.title: Essential Health Check-up

steps.title: Dental Inspection
content: Check for cracks from tough bamboo stalks
Look for signs of gum irritation
Pandas have 42 teeth—all must be functional
steps.hint: A panda's bite is stronger than a polar bear's!

steps.title: Weight Monitoring
content: Adult males: 85–125 kg
Adult females: 70–100 kg
Rapid weight loss usually indicates bamboo quality issues
steps.hint: They can lose weight quickly during the mating season.

steps.title: Coat and Skin Health
content: Check for parasites in the thick fur
Skin should be clear under the white patches
Excessive scratching can indicate stress
steps.hint: Their fur is oily to protect them from the rain.

summary: Teeth are a panda's most important tool.
Stable weight is a sign of a good diet.
Preventive care extends their life significantly.

faq.question: How long do pandas live?
faq.answer: 15-20 years in the wild, up to 30 in captivity.

guides.title: How to Identify a Giant Panda

steps.title: Spot the Patches
content: Black circles around the eyes
Black ears and black legs/shoulders
The rest of the coat is creamy white
steps.hint: Each panda's eye patches are as unique as a fingerprint.

steps.title: Check the Tail
content: Pandas have short, stubby tails
The tail is usually around 10–15 cm long
It is white, unlike the red panda's long striped tail
steps.hint: A panda's tail is the second longest in the bear family.

steps.title: Size and Stature
content: Adults are 1.2 to 1.9 meters long
They stand about 60–90 cm at the shoulder
A heavy, round body shape helps with heat retention
steps.hint: They look fluffy, but they are very muscular bears.

summary: The black-and-white coat is perfect camouflage in snow and shadows.
No two pandas look exactly the same.

faq.question: Are there brown pandas?
faq.answer: Yes! The rare Qinling panda has brown and tan fur.

guides.title: Seasonal Bamboo Guide

steps.title: Spring: The Shoot Season
content: Focus on bamboo shoots (very high protein)
Pandas eat the most during this time
Shoots provide the energy for the breeding season
steps.hint: Shoots are like 'candy' for pandas.

steps.title: Summer: Transition to Leaves
content: As shoots harden, pandas move to leaves
They seek higher ground for fresher growth
Feeding speed slows down compared to spring
steps.hint: They follow the 'bamboo growth' up the mountain.

steps.title: Winter: The Leaf Struggle
content: Focus on older leaves and stalks
Lower energy content means less movement
Panda will move to lower altitudes to find green plants
steps.hint: They conserve energy by sleeping more in winter.

summary: Nutrition needs change with the seasons.
Shoots are the most nutritious part.
Pandas are highly adaptable to what part of bamboo is available.

faq.question: Do they drink a lot of water?
faq.answer: Yes, especially when eating dry stalks.
